original.definition: be present or associated with an event or entity

sememes.reasoning: The definition 'be present or associated with' describes a continuous state of relationship or co-occurrence, not an action or a discrete event.

participants.reasoning: The first 'Something' in the frame, which is the entity that is present or associated.
The second 'something' (object of 'with'), which is the entity or event that the first 'Something' is associated with. This indicates a joint presence or inherent connection.

Evidentiality.reasoning: The verb describes a factual state of being associated, implying direct or certain knowledge.

Mood.reasoning: The verb's core meaning is declarative, stating a fact about a relationship.

Modality.reasoning: The frame 'Something come_with something' indicates a non-agentive subject, and the verb describes a state, thus lacking agent's will.

Polarity.reasoning: The state of being associated is inherently neutral; its positive or negative valence depends on the context.

Volitionality.reasoning: The frame 'Something come_with something' implies a non-volitional subject and describes an inherent state or property, not an intentional action.

Confidence.reasoning: The verb describes a definite state of association.

Iterativity.reasoning: As a continuous state, the concept of repetition is not applicable. It is treated as a single, ongoing instance.

participants.reasoning: semantic_role 'co_participant.n.01' is not a valid synset in NLTK.

candidates.description: a game in which participants compete to identify some obscurely indicated thing (gloss match)
a lottery in which the prize consists of the money paid by the participants (gloss match)
a system of conduct in which participants are trusted not to take unfair advantage of others (gloss match)

a fraudulent scheme in which people are recruited to make payments to the person who recruited them while expecting to receive payments from the persons they recruit; when the number of new recruits fails to sustain the hierarchical payment structure the scheme collapses with most of the participants losing the money they put in (gloss match)

the function of pointing or specifying from the perspective of a participant in an act of speech or writing; aspects of a communication whose interpretation depends on knowledge of the context in which the communication occurs (gloss match)
(psychology) bias introduced by an experimenter whose expectations about the outcome of the experiment can be subtly communicated to the participants in the experiment (gloss match)
a court order restricting information or comment by the participants involved in a lawsuit (gloss match)
a central collection place where banks exchange checks or drafts; participants maintain an account against which credits or debits are posted (gloss match)
a meeting or conference for the public discussion of some topic especially one in which the participants form an audience and make presentations (gloss match)
an important participant (as in a business deal) (gloss match)
childbirth during which the mother is encouraged to be an active participant (gloss match)
an economic condition that results in the elimination of marginally financed participants in an industry (gloss match)
